Supposing <math>\phi</math> is a [[Propositional Formula|propositional formula]], then it is a function defined as follows:<math display="block">\bar{v}\left(\phi \right)=
\begin{cases}
  v\left(\phi \right) \text{ if } \phi \text{ is a propositional variable }\\
  F \text{ if } \phi :\equiv \left( \neg A \right) \text{ and } \bar{v}\left(A\right)=T \\
  F \text{ if } \phi :\equiv \left( A \lor B\right) \text{ and } \bar{v}\left(A\right)=\bar{v}\left(B\right)=F\\
  T \text{ otherwise }
\end{cases}</math>
